links.title: Return On Capital Employed Overview: Eli Lilly
links.description: Looking at Q3, Eli Lilly (NYSE: LLY) earned $1.28 billion, a 6.81% increase from the preceding quarter. Eli Lilly also posted a total of $5.74 billion in sales, a 4.4% increase since Q2. In Q2, Eli Lilly earned $1.20 billion, and total sales reached $5.50 billion.

links.title: Lilly chief defends need for antibody treatment despite availability of vaccine (NYSE:LLY)
links.description: In an interview on CNBC, Eli Lilly Chairman and CEO Dave Ricks emphasized that there will still be a need for coronavirus antibody treatments, such as newly EUA-approved bamlanivimab (formerly LY-CoV555), even if a vaccine is widely available. "I am so pleased to hear about Pfizer's news yesterday and we hope that makes up obsolete.

messages.body:
$SRNE President of Eli Lilly $LLY saying vaccine does not make antibodies obsolete.  (I believe $SRNE does it better)

 “Even in well-controlled [other] respiratory illness ... we still have vaccination and antibody therapy because some patients escape the vaccine and still get the condition, and they need to be managed with a therapy,” he explained. “This will be useful” in fighting Covid-19 as well, he added.

https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/10/eli-lilly-says-covid-antibody-drugs-needed-even-if-theres-a-vaccine.html

links.title: Eli Lilly's coronavirus antibody treatment will be needed even if there is a vaccine, CEO says
links.description: Eli Lilly Chairman and CEO Dave Ricks told CNBC on Tuesday the company's coronavirus antibody drug will still be an important treatment for Covid-19, even if a widely available vaccine is brought to market. The Food and Drug Administration granted Eli Lilly's antibody treatment emergency use authorization Monday evening, allowing it to be given to non-hospitalized patients who are at high risk of developing severe Covid-19.

messages.body: $SPY watch $LLY today

$SRNE WNYC at 8:03 a.m. this morning regarding $LLY antibodies, "we do not want people going to an emergency room for this infusuon. It's unclear where they are going to go"  

They can go to a CVS and get a dose of  Sorrento's  antibodies administered via intranasal mist.

https://investors.sorrentotherapeutics.com/news-releases/news-release-details/sorrento-announces-intranasal-administration-covi-amgtm-0

*There was not a clip of the segment on the site but this one regarding hospitals capacity and their wanting to keep covid patients out speaks loudly to the thesis. 

https://www.wnyc.org/shows/me

links.title: Sorrento Announces That Intranasal Administration of COVI-AMG™ Neutralizing Antibody Prevented COVID-19 Disease Progression in Infected Hamsters Following SARS-CoV-2 Infection | Sorrento Therapeutics
links.description: In an IND-enabling study, intranasal COVI-AMG nAb (STI-2099 or COVI-DROPSTM) very early on decreased COVID-19 disease severity and shortened the duration of the disease in infected hamsters, and Sorrento is in preparation for IND filings for both intranasal COVI-DROPS nAb (STI-2099) and intravenous COVI-AMG nAb (STI-2020) in November 2020.

links.title: Some States Announce New Restrictions as U.S. Passes 10 Million Covid Cases
links.description: The U.S. surpassed 10 million total Covid-19 cases Monday and there are few signs that the resurgence of the virus will fade. New coronavirus cases topped 100,000 for the seventh day in a row, according to Johns Hopkins University. Cases are rising in nearly every state.

links.title: Barron's Daily: Beyond Meat's Bad Day Shows How Hard It Is to Be the Next Big Thing
links.description: It's hard to be the next big thing. Sales came in at $94 million, when Wall Street was looking for $132 million, after topping sales estimates in its first six quarters reported as a public company. Beyond blamed pantry stock in the second quarter for the miss.
